body_html:
From the comments to the line in code in question, the choice of retaining the deprecated feature seems to be intentional:
tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/head.py:642

    # Uses the deprecated API to set the tag explicitly.
    # Without it, training and eval losses will show up in different graphs.
    logging_ops.scalar_summary(
        _summary_key(head_name, mkey.LOSS), weighted_average_loss)

While I understand the rationale, the resulting cluttering of the log makes it rather difficult to read.

body:
From the comments to the line in code in question, the choice of retaining the deprecated feature seems to be intentional:
tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/head.py:642
```
    # Uses the deprecated API to set the tag explicitly.
    # Without it, training and eval losses will show up in different graphs.
    logging_ops.scalar_summary(
        _summary_key(head_name, mkey.LOSS), weighted_average_loss)
```
While I understand the rationale, the resulting cluttering of the log makes it rather difficult to read.
